fields_of_interest: Budget, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: Public procurement, access to information, copyright, anti-corruption, whistleblowing, EU public prosecutor, European Values Instrument, GDPR, Countering Fake News
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
K-Monitor is an anti-corruption grass root NGO founded in 2007. K-Monitor strives against corruption and promotes the transparency of public spending in Hungary. K-Monitor operates open data websites, conducts research and advocates for legal reform.  With the contribution of our researches, analyses and recommendations, we aim to challenge and overcome the social indifference to corruption, to raise awareness and disseminate knowledge. We truly believe that information technology can contribute to a more open, more transparent and more democratic way of governing. Therefore K-Monitor develops databases and online tools by which public expenses become trackable, and decision makers can be hold accountable. 
Principles of our operation are openness, independence and a critical approach.
